thread.title: Jayvee field hockey players enjoy jamboree at PITCH
thread.title_full: Jayvee field hockey players enjoy jamboree at PITCH

author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Ken Waltz)
title: Jayvee field hockey players enjoy jamboree at PITCH
text:
Jayvee field hockey players enjoy jamboree at PITCH Young Ocenside, Belfast, Mount View, Camden Hills athletes participate By Ken Waltz | Oct 19, 2015 Photo by: Ken Waltz 
Warren â€” Often high school junior varsity student-athletes are lost in obscurity and toil away from the spotlight, but for a four-hour period each fall, subvarsity field hockey players take center stage during the JV Jamboree at The PITCH. 
The second annual event took place on Friday afternoon and night, Oct. 16, with 15 teams and nearly 150 players enjoying a slew of fast-paced games on the artificial surface of the indoor facility. 
Martha Meyer, a longtime field hockey official, again coordinated the event at The PITCH. 
"It was quite an evening," Meyer said. 
Defending champion Gardiner won by goal-differential over Lawrence "B" (the Bulldogs of Fairfield brought two teams). 
Meyer said the event increased by five teams over last year. 
Each team played four 30-minute games. Four games at once were played on the field surface, which was divided into four equal smaller fields, which made for fast action and lots of scoring opportunities 
The event was sponsored by the Central Maine Board of Field Hockey Officials and proceeds go to the Gail Santerre Development Fund for officials who want to progress in their abilities. 
The teams who participated were Oceanside of Rockland/Thomaston, Camden Hills of Rockport, Belfast, Mount View of Thorndike, Lawrence of Fairfield A and B, Hall-Dale of Farmingdale, Boothbay Region, Mount Blue of Farmington, Erskine Academy of South China, Morse of Bath, Mount Ararat of Topsham A and B, Gardiner and Maine Central Institute of Pittsfield. 
For the Midcoast teams, Oceanside finished 3-1 with 13 goals for and nine against for nine points. The Mariners were fifth. 
The complete results for each team, with record, goals-for, goals-against and points listed were: Gardiner, 4-0, 17-2, 12 points; Lawrence "B," 4-0, 19-7, 12 points; MCI, 3-1, 14-7, 9 points; Lawrence "A," 3-1, 12-5, 7 points; Oceanside, 3-1, 13-9, 9 points; Mount Ararat "B," 3-1, 9-9, 9 points; Morse 2-1-1, 15-9, 7 points; Hall-Dale, 2-1-1, 13-9, 7 points; Mount Ararat "A," 1-3, 7-10, 3 points; Mount View, 1-3, 9-14, 3 points; Erskine Academy, 1-3, 8-13, 3 points; Mount Blue, 1-3, 5-13, 3 points; Belfast, 1-3, 7-17, 3 points; Boothbay 0-4, 4-15, no points; and Camden Hills, 0-4, 1-14, no points. 
Complete scores and other information can be found by clicking here . (Photo by: Ken Waltz)
